Case studies

An overview of 7 projects

Pattern Library, Agency-Style

Role: Designer Results: Average 12% conversion rate Timeline: 1 year

We had inefficiency from design and dev building every site from scratch. After collaborating with the design team and dev team we created a pattern library which shaved 2 days off of dev build time and 1 off of design.

Pattern Library, Agency-Style

Role: Designer Results: Average 12% conversion rate Timeline: 1 year

We had inefficiency from design and dev building every site from scratch. After collaborating with the design team and dev team we created a pattern library which shaved 2 days off of dev build time and 1 off of design.

My part in this projecy was creating new patterns, maintaining existing patterns, writing documentation, and (the big one)using the library. Each desiign required staying within the bounds of each pattern.

Created Strong Identity Systems for 400 Small Businesses

Designer | Average 12% conversion rate | 5 years

Clients often came to our marketing company with very little. Usually a logo and that logo applied to their service truck. With that, I created an identity system and applied it to a new website. The system was then used for other products, like social media, email marketing, and remarketing.

Specifically, the system included fonts, colors, buttons, patterns, custom iconography like guarantees and warranties, and occasionally a mascot.

View site

Mockup Demo Tool

Role: Design, Development, PM

Results: Legacy tool

Timeline: 1 month

We had a clunky PDF method for presenting site mockups to clients which resulted in lots of questions from clients. My simple solution received almost immediate positive feedback from managers and clients.

I initiated and championed this small project from pitch to launch.

View sample (http://wescarr.com/drop/mockup-demo/intro)

Rock & Roll Daycare

Role: Custom UI Design / Art Direction

Supported growth of award-winning Boston Montessori School

Challenge

One of my freelance clients was starting a new venture. Since we collaborated on a different music academy website, much of the functionality was able to be reused. The design goals were to increase sign-ups and provide info to existing customers. The back-end required the ability to add faculty, update availability, and edit content sections. The old and new one would be using WordPress.

Available Resources

I wore all of the required hats: design, development, mailchimp integration, and ongoing support. For the other music academy site, I joined forces with a developer. The client supplied all content.

Process & Timeline

  1. Define the scope and timeline for both parties
  2. Design blocky wireframes to focus broadly
  3. Complete style guide to touch on the details
  4. Develop beta site
  5. Connect mailing list and create email marketing strategy
  6. Launch and deliver documentation: WordPress Tips and Website Manual
  7. Maintenance and updates during our 2 year relationship.

Wireframe

Style guide

Beta site

What did I learn?

The most challenging part of the project was expanding the site’s capabilities as the business grew. They began with one location and added three more. The growth meant more faculty roles tied to particular locations. I felt over my head and reached out to developer friends who set me back on the right path. With their help a solution was delivered. It was a reminder for me of the importance of your actual social network.

Deliverables: Site design, Custom WordPress Theme, WordPress Manual, Website Manual, Email integration

Thanks for being here.
